lines.text: [Kathy exits out of her dad's car in anger]
No! No! No more! You know something, you embarrass me! You're always around - around my friends, at church! You're always hanging on me!

[approaches her]
Don't say that, please, please.

[walks away, furiously]
How the hell else am I gonna get you to listen to me? Sometimes, I think you're deaf and dumb!
I don't know who killed Kathy. I'm just trying to tell you that I don't have a husband anymore, and I can't support the family I've got left. I can't even see them! Now when do I get my kids back?

[sternly]
Until it is proven that you yourself had nothing to do with either your daughter's murder or ANY abuse that might be found, social services won't have anything to do with...

[sadly]
Maybe I was. Maybe I was. I was supposed to keep my kids safe... and I didn't do that.
